question.body: In a person with the genetic disease albinism, the eyes are red. This red color is a result of what?

multiple_choice.choice: Too much pheomelanin being produced and giving a reddish tint.
Too little melanin being produced and the blood vessels showing through.
The melanosomes fusing too soon with the lysosomes.
An uneven distribution of the melanocytes.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Even though pheomelanin does have more of a reddish tint, if someone has albinism they are not producing this type of melanin.
Correct. With a lack of melanin, the red of the blood can show through in the eyes.
Incorrect. Melanosomes are cells that contain melanin. In albinism, melanin is not produced.
Incorrect. Uneven distribution of melanocytes can result in freckles, not albinism.

part.hint: Eye color is determined by the same chemical that determines skin color.
